review_title: Great place to grow your career
pros: Wide variety of jobs to start a career and many opportunities for growth. Stormont has scholarships, a Foundation to help with education and other career expenses, offers tons of education both in person and through online modules, and promote from within whenever possible.
cons: Healthcare is just a tough field to work in right now. Coming out of COVID many are still exhausted and stressed and at times that manifests in how staff treat each other and how engaged they are with new hires. Enrollment is down in schools for the healthcare professions which is causing staffing issues, further adding to the exhaustion and stress levels of staff.

pros: They are competitive with pay and try not to overwork you, which is rare in this field.
cons: Like everywhere, they are understaffed with nurses.

job_title: Patient Safety Sitter in Topeka, KS
pros: I liked the teamwork of the nurses, PCTs, and sitters on the acute care floors. Sometimes the patients were enjoyable and not too much of a hassle. Good training for an entry level job if you are interested in entering the healthcare field.
cons: Some of the patients were overwhelming especially if you were working a pod on your own. Everyone was so busy with their own stuff at times that you would have to deal with issues on your own. Quick escalations of patients could make working with them sometimes scary.

review_title: I'm a Patient Care Technician. Not worth the stress
job_title: Patient Care Technician/Cna in Topeka, KS
pros: Meeting new people all the time, you ends up making new friends with most of the staff.  Depending on department toy might learn new skills as well and sometimes help with bedside procedures.. At first they treat you like your an amazing person and very much part of the team after training you're just another slave.. taking orders.. I adore my department bosses, and some of my co-workers,  however the staff to patient ratio is heavy and unsafe
cons: Workload unrealistically heavy at times, very unsafe the number in falls has risen immensely,  the pay sucks for the workload, not worth the stress or the pay.  They never take enough taxes out so some employees end up owing at the end of the yr.  After asking for raise after being there for 2yrs, when I found out that girls that I've trained got more money than myself I was told they couldn't do anything about it and told me not to talk about my wages on the floor!! Also some nurses refuse to help so as a tech your left to care for all patients on your own

cons: Benefits aren't that great and expensive.

review_title: Very nursing oreinted.  It gives a message that a "nurse" can do anything. ---NOT
pros: Great equipment, Over all exceptional people.  Always get paid.  Enough work for everyone.  Envolved in community events.  Do medical spots on the news.  Large workforce.
cons: Spending money foolishly.  Like on Magnet staus--why did they spend money for someone to tell us we're doing a good job?  Give the workers the time and money to do an exceptional job and word of mouth will bring in customers--do lay people even know what "Magnet" is--NO!  Most of SV staffers don't get it.  It also took internal money for people to work on it and it has to continue to keep recieving this recognision.  Ridiculous, espicially when there is no money to provide a better invironment, working conditions for their employees.  Magnet has put more strain on the ones doing patient care for all the extra stuff that has to be done.  Let us take care of the patient!!!  New charting system--very much needed.  First though wouldn't it be better to fix the computer issues.  Not enough in every department, some really outdated, servers not big enough.  Did we get the cart before the horse?

pros: Enjoyed seeing baby’s brought into this world. Some of the co-workers were helpful and great.
cons:
Management will act like you’re a great worker but the moment you mess up they turn their back on you and treat you like you are a bad employee. 

Charge nurses wait too long to let you know if you are doing something incorrectly and then write you up for it.

A particular charge nurse stated “all the pcts suck and should be fired”. Clearly they don’t know how to be a leader and teach. They are very quick to come down on you. 

Work load is heavier then some units especially on the labor side. If you are scrubbed into a C-Section and another person delivers, all they will do is push the delivery cart and trash into the dirty utility room and wait for you to clean and restock it. You’ll find the nurses chatting at the desk or on their phone rather then helping you out but lord forbid you don’t help a nurse out when they are busy. 

Poor benefits and pay. Good luck trying to take family leave as they outsourced their call service to an out of state company who handles FMLA requests. Retirement plan is lousy too. 

If you work nightshift, don’t expect to get good hot food options before the cafeteria closes at 8:30 on Sunday and 10:30 during the week.

pros: Fast paced medical field 🏥
cons: 🤷🏼‍♀️I don’t know any cons

pros: Good camraderie among most staff at least on my unit, Good opportunity for advancement, good potential for growth and modern technology to assist in caring for patients
cons: Pay for a Staff RN coming straight out of school is not in line with what other facilities of a similar caliber are paying. There are many problems with the supply chain, it's hard to care for patients when you don't have basic supplies.  Night shift is neglected by management especially in regards to special events for things like Nurse's week. Special barbeques and food deals are offered to the Day shift but night shift gets neglected.

pros: Tuition reimbursement, PTO, low work burden in outpatient setting.
cons: Pay, benefits, difficult to use EIB, heavy on management positions. The small moments campaign is a great idea, it was costly I'm sure. I feel the buy in by Mr. Peterson, however, I don't feel it from other members of the operating committee.

pros: Strive for the best patient care.  Seem to be making some upper management changes so will see if this changes anything.
cons: Too many people in upper management and not enough doing patient care.  Falling behind in pay.

pros: I truly enjoy my counterparts as coworkers and as people. Oh, and 3rd shift differential is nice...

review_title: The benefits are very generous compared to other hospitals
pros: PTO accrues with each pay period and can be shared employee to employee.  When employees share PTO SVHC pays the receiving employee at their pay rate which could be higher.
cons: They attempt to promote from within, however they seem to be not following that on the management level.  There are many qualified employees that are not considered for upper level positions.

job_title: Certified Surgical Tech in Topeka, KS
pros: Big hospital, get to do a variety of cases. Surgeons are great to work for
cons: The management in surgery is very bad. We're treated horribly. They show favoritism. Very low morale. Required to take A Lot Of call. Policies are changed daily. Too many people in charge, fighting over power. Charge nurses talk down to us, they're unprofessional, they change rules for favorites.

review_title: First job.  Was a great place to learn and promote within.
